title: Fixes a bug in the Java 6 JVM where primitive arrays have a wrong type.
[FLINK-927] Quick and dirty fix for FLINK-927 and added more diagnostics information
body:
CompactingHashTable now always checks if it was closed by another process.
If it was closed it does nothing.

Added more information about memory consumption to exception messages.

title: Bugfix: CoGroup SolutionSetFirst
body:
This PR deals with the issue described here:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-922

title: FS.get(): Add URI causing exception to message.
body: The current exception is, in cases where multiple paths are used, not particularly helpful, as such i extended it.

title: [FLINK-903] Rebase ML API example
body: I rebase the ML API example. Welcome for advice!

title: Syntactic sugar for sum, min, and max aggregations
body: This is just adding the ability to call .sum(n), .min(n), and .max(n) on a DataSet instead of .aggregate(SUM, n) etc

title: [FLINK-898] Clean up distribution default config
body:
This PR cleans up the distribution default config.

Removed entries:
- `env.java.home`,
- `env.java.opts`,
- `jobmanager.profiling.enable`,
- `jobmanager.rpc.handler`, 
- `jobmanager.web.history`,
- `taskmanager.rpc.port`,
- `taskmanager.network.bufferSizeInBytes`,
- `webclient.rootpath`,
- `webclient.tempdir`,
- `webclient.uploaddir`, and
- `webclient.plandump`.

Active entries:
- `jobmanager.rpc.address: localhost`
- `jobmanager.rpc.port: 6123`,
- `jobmanager.heap.mb: 256`,
- `taskmanager.heap.mb: 512`,
- `parallelization.degree.default: 1`,
- `jobmanager.web.port: 8081`, and
- `webclient.port: 8080`.

Suggested entries:
- `taskmanager.network.numberOfBuffers: 2048`,
- `taskmanager.tmp.dirs: /tmp`, and
- `fs.hdfs.hadoopconf: /path/to/hadoop/conf/`.

`webclient.port` and `taskmanager.network.numberOfBuffers` will be removed in the future, when the web interfaces have been merged and the memory management reworked.

title: [FLINK-917] Rename netty IO thread count parameters
body:
Renames config parameters introduced in 4cd4a13415d609a2979c8fa3cf4b797c990ee8c2:
- `taskmanager.netty.numInThreads => taskmanager.net.numInThreads`, and
- `taskmanager.netty.numOutThreads => taskmanager.net.numOutThreads`.

title: Serialized String comparison, Unicode support
body:
The StringComparator now works on serialized data.

To this end new string read/write/copy/compare methods were introduced, which use a variable-length encoding for the characters.

~~key-points:~~
  ~~\- The most significant bits are written/read first.~~
  ~~\- The first 2 bits of the character are used to encode the size of the character.~~
 ~~\- A character is at most 3 Bytes big.~~

Additionally, the StringSerializer now has full unicode support. ~~i couldn't find a unicode character that ~~uses more than 22 bits, as such 3 Bytes should be sufficient.~~

title: DistCache: executable flag, dir support
body:
new features:
- you can now distribute whole directories (this copies all files tracked by `listStatus` recursively)
- when distributing single files they can be tagged as executable (automatically checked for local files)

other changes:
- the name/path scheme was changed to preserve the original name. all files are now stored in a job-specific folder, instead of having a job/identifier specific name.
- the arguments passed when registering a file are abstracted away in its own data structure, making it easier to expand the DC the future. (there is no reason why one should have to change `NepheleJobGraphGenerator` or `TaskManager` for this)
- reworded/expanded some javadocs, and made it clear that local files can only be used when they are accessible form all workers

title: ForwardFields Optimizer integration
body: This PR enables that forwarded fields are considered in the optimizer when they are not forwarded to the same output field.

title: Fix for FLINK-708 and FLINK-887
body:
I tested Flink on Amazon EMR (Hadoop 2.4.0). It was necessary to change some code due to a API change in YARN. Flink should now support all Hadoop versions >= 2.2.0.

I also fixed the JobManager heap space calculation for YARN. The JM sometimes failed one large jobs.

I would like to include the commit into the 0.5.1 release.
